title.rendered: Windows 10 Release: Exclusive Minecraft beta announced

content.rendered:
Beta on July 29th

Minecraft appears as a Windows 10 edition. A beta phase has already been announced – an exact release date is still pending.

News


With the release of Windows 10 there is a new Minecraft edition.© Mojang AB

Minecraft release for Windows 10: As Microsoft announced on the Windows Blog, the company is working with the Mojang developer studio on a Windows 10 edition of the popular sandbox game. A beta phase has already been announced.

The beta test is scheduled to start on July 29, 2015, the day of the Windows 10 release. Minecraft Windows 10 Edition is free to download for owners of the original game. The price for newcomers is 10 US dollars.

The download of the new Minecraft edition is possible on both PC and tablet. As usual with sandbox gaming, all future updates to the game will be free for Minecraft owners.

According to Microsoft, the Windows 10 edition should have extended features compared to the original version. Minecraft can be used with up to seven players in a local network or online via the Xbox Live network. Players still have to be patient for a co-op mode with owners of the Pocket Edition – this function should be added with an update.

In addition, the player can easily navigate through the Minecraft world with many different input devices – whether gamepad, touchscreen or keyboard and mouse: the change should be easy and uncomplicated.

In addition, thanks to the built-in game DVR (Digital Video Recording) from Microsoft, users can record and save in-game scenes in Minecraft and share them with friends. When exactly the beta phase of the Minecraft Windows 10 edition will end and the official release will take place is still unclear.
